decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to utilize the aggressive creatures in the Mardu colors (white, black, red) combined with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Thoughtseize to maintain board control and pressure the opponent. The deck also incorporates disruption with cards like Cabal Therapy and Hexing Squelcher to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of efficient creatures, removal, and disruption spells, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to generate tempo by using disruptive spells and efficient creatures. This Dimir Tempo deck aims to control the game early with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, while also applying pressure with creatures like Barrowgoyf and Murktide Regent. By utilizing cards like Daze and Force of Will to disrupt your opponent's game plan, and using cards like Brainstorm and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to ensure you have the right answers at the right time, this deck seeks to outpace and outmaneuver your opponent to secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy using disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will while maintaining tempo with efficient creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and Murktide Regent. The deck also includes a variety of removal spells such as Fatal Push and Snuff Out to deal with threats on the board. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and Brazen Borrower offers flexibility in dealing with both creatures and non-creature threats. The mana base is optimized for consistency and the inclusion of powerful one-drop spells like Brainstorm and Daze help to keep the pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on assembling the Doomsday combo to win the game quickly. It utilizes cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to generate mana, while using Doomsday to stack the library in a way that allows Thassa's Oracle to win the game upon resolution. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will, Daze, and Thoughtseize to protect the combo. The inclusion of Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Murktide Regent provides additional card advantage and threats to pressure the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently combo off and win before the opponent can disrupt the strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent to apply pressure on the opponent while controlling the game with cards like Force of Will, Daze, and Lightning Bolt. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal while maintaining a strong board presence to quickly close out the game. It also uses cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to filter through the deck and find the necessary cards to win.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and tempo while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Murktide Regent and Orcish Bowmasters. It uses a combination of discard spells, countermagic, and removal to control the game and protect its threats. The deck aims to quickly establish board presence and maintain it through disruption, card advantage, and efficient use of resources. It seeks to win the game by overwhelming the opponent with a combination of disruption and aggressive creatures, while controlling the board and preventing the opponent from mounting a strong defense.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of cards to quickly and efficiently win the game by milling the entire library and then casting Thassa's Oracle to win with its triggered ability. It employs a range of mana acceleration cards, reanimation spells, and protection spells to ensure the combo can go off smoothly. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful and fast win condition, often catching them off guard. The intricate interactions between various cards make it a challenging but rewarding archetype to pilot in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck focuses on utilizing the powerful combo of Show and Tell with either Sneak Attack or Omniscience to quickly bring out big creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck includes a mix of lands, cantrips, and counterspells to ensure consistency and protection while also including cards like Stock Up and Veil of Summer for additional utility and disruption. The goal is to efficiently cheat out huge threats early in the game to overpower opponents and secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw. It utilizes efficient creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Orcish Bowmasters to control the board, while also using powerful spells like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage, while Quantum Riddler adds a unique twist to the control strategy. The deck aims to outlast the opponent and ultimately win the game through superior card advantage and control of the battlefield.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Archon of Cruelty, then use spells like Reanimate and Exhume to bring them back into play. Cards like Unmask and Thoughtseize help to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Lotus Petal and Dark Ritual provide the necessary mana acceleration. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures early in the game, leading to a quick victory through a powerful reanimation strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like White Orchid Phantom and Skyclave Apparition, in combination with disruptive cards like Swords to Plowshares and Thoughtseize, to control the board and apply pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of Aether Vial helps to cheat out creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes powerful cards like Solitude and Recruiter of the Guard to maintain board presence. The use of Karakas and Wasteland allows for additional disruption and protection against opposing threats.

The main focus of this Aggro - Death & Taxes deck is to utilize a combination of disruptive creatures, powerful removal spells, and mana denial through Wasteland to control the game and put pressure on the opponent. By utilizing cards like Skyclave Apparition and Swords to Plowshares to deal with threats, Recruiter of the Guard to search for key creatures, and Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and finish the game with efficient beatdown creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd.

This deck focuses on utilizing the card Doomsday to set up a winning combination with Thassa's Oracle, allowing the player to win the game on the spot. The deck includes various forms of card selection, disruption, and mana acceleration to enable the combo to be executed efficiently and protect it from opposing strategies. By carefully planning out the sequencing of spells and utilizing the right resources at the right time, the player aims to quickly assemble the necessary pieces for victory before their opponent can respond effectively.

This deck focuses on utilizing Gaea's Cradle to generate large amounts of mana quickly, allowing the player to ramp up their board presence and control the game. By consistently searching for key cards with Green Sun's Zenith and Once Upon a Time, while also disrupting the opponent with Thoughtseize, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Wight of the Reliquary and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. The inclusion of various mana dorks like Birds of Paradise and Noble Hierarch help to accelerate the deck's game plan, making it a potent control deck in the Legacy format.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up and play powerful Eldrazi creatures, using cards like Eldrazi Temple, Eye of Ugin, and Lotus Petal to accelerate into threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. Chalice of the Void and Wasteland are used to disrupt opponents' strategies, while Glaring Fleshraker and It That Heralds the End provide additional aggression. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with big creatures and efficient mana usage, creating a fast and aggressive game plan that can quickly close out games.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void while quickly ramping up to drop powerful threats like Broadside Bombardiers and Hexing Squelcher. The goal is to control the board and end the game quickly with an aggressive approach, using cards like Sundering Eruption and Fury to clear the way for your creatures. The synergy between cards like Chrome Mox, Ancient Tomb, and Simian Spirit Guide allows for explosive plays early in the game to overwhelm the opponent.
